Review.Titre: This is a scam
Review.Contenu: This is a scam. You pay and in return all you get is soliciting and more soliciting.

Review.Titre: Received an email from an elderly…
Review.Contenu: Received an email from an elderly client who has verified she has never heard of Alignable. Concerned with security and verification and the ability of third parties to "spoof" an "invitation" email from an elderly woman.

Review.Titre: I received a bogus email from…
Review.Contenu: I received a bogus email from Alignable. They were impersonating one of our partners in business introducing the platform. We confirmed that our partner never sent the request and doesn't use the platform. Alignable made the email appear to come from someone else. Beware of emails from Alignable.

Review.Titre: This company continues to send me…
Review.Contenu: This company continues to send me unwanted emails and I am considering legal action since there is no way to contact them'Today, November 3,2023 Alignable sent a response that I can simply “unsubscribe “ but I think it is important to note that this company sends emails from people you have a connection with on LinkedIn for example, and make it seem as though the email was sent by that person. This is what I consider to be fraud. Just like the person that did the next complaint under this one. I had that very same experience. Why should I have to be the person to take an action to stop Alignable from contacting me? The unmitigated nerve of these people. To put it bluntly, they are terrible! Also like the person that did the review below my review, Alignable made it appear as though someone in my network emailed me and I contacted that person and they confirmed they did not send the email. FRAUD!

Review.Titre: The worst
Review.Contenu: The worstSending emails to everyone i ever sent an email?From my business email?The worst

Review.Titre: Scam Company, Rips You Off, and Spams You!
Review.Contenu: I tried Alignable because "said other business network" was going downhill. I even opted for the premium membership and their newsletter upgrade advertisement to send event info to my select areas. Spent over $1000 on this network and I didn't even get a newsletter to show me where my ad was, just a "confirmation" it was sent! Received absolutely no new business, connections, or anything relevant in my area. They spammed my contact list, I couldn't get a hold of their customer service", and I couldn't remove my company after I got ripped off! Not worth it, don't bother! This is a scam company!

Review.Titre: Using my contact list without permission is not OK!
Review.Contenu: I received an invitation to join from someone I know and accepted it. I did not give permission for Alignable to access my contact list, yet several people I know have received invitations to join purportedly from me. I want to just get off...it's not something I really need and I am disappointed that other people are now getting what seem to them to be spam emails from me. Please let me know how I can get off Alignable.

Review.Titre: they are using my name to email other…
Review.Contenu: they are using my name to email other people and pretend is me who sent those emails. unacceptable.Hi,It’s Dario from Dario Garcia Insurance Agency in South Salt Lake.I’d like to be able to refer customers to you, so I’ve added you to my network on Alignable, a site exclusively for business owners to network with each other.Accept my invitation(Note: this invite expires in 24 hours)

Review.Titre: On the Low End of Real Estate Software
Review.Contenu: Product is difficult to use and getting hold of a live person is practically impossible. I've asked their "Support" staff, such as it is, multiple times, to stop sending unsolicited requests to connect from me to other business. They say they've turned that feature off, then it starts again.

Review.Titre: Sorry folks; to me it's a sham
Review.Contenu: Sorry folks, but I find the whole thing to be a farce.  It all seems to be based on how many recommendations everyone has.  But what I see is a bunch of people making and/or asking for recommendations from or to people who they don't know and have never even met.  How can you possibly give an honest recommendation to a person or business that you have absolutely no experience with.  That fact, in itself, makes the whole concept a sham.

Review.Titre: I found the service very expensive for…
Review.Contenu: I found the service very expensive for market coverage….C$300-500 per prospective customer to look at our sponsorship page. No new customers. Maybe alignable is just not big or relevant in our area. It was very difficult to navigate their site to cancel or change and customer service very difficult to reach.  No phone nos available….only web service. Frustrating.The impressions are not representative of anything significant for marketing results. The 9 warm leads, were mostly are friends and colleagues …not true prospective customers. None become new customers. Over 4 months of about C$1500…disappointing results. Sorry.

Review.Titre: Once you dive in deeper you learn that…
Review.Contenu: Once you dive in deeper you learn that not everyone is legit on Alignable.  Beware of hard money lenders - big scam site for them :(  Even the "Recommendations" aren't trustworthy!  Private money scammers are posing as legitimate lenders and using info to look like they are real.  Talk to them before sending $$ if their voice sounds suspicious and their email doesn't exactly match the website, just beware.  Do a lot of research and try not to get so caught up emotionally that you will be receiving money.  I learned the hard way.  Don't Zelle or Venmo etc.  These guys have become very knowledgeable in the industry.

Review.Titre: No Support and Intrusive
Review.Contenu: They bait you into thinking contacts of yours are on the platform when they arent and spam them acting like you invited them... they will not respond to support emails nor give any rhyme or reason why their site is broken other than upgrade to premium for better support...

Review.Titre: So far one of the worst support I have…
Review.Contenu: So far one of the worst support I have ever experienced. I'm a premium member. I have reached out to my support "coach" it took 3 days to get a response that did not deal with my issue, (not being able to create a product because alignable things it's already been created), When I responded with exact pictures and an even more detailed description of the issue, I got nothing back from my "premium coach" it's been over a week and I'm left extremely disappointed. I've worked with free services that had better support!

Review.Titre: Fake and False site
Review.Contenu: Fake and False site.  Every week we receive an email from the Company informing us of a Promotion 'we sent in last week' and how they sent it to 470 viewers.  We wrote back to say we have not posted anything for over a year.  Our email came back "Oops. Your reply ended up in an unattended mailbox".  They continuously ask for referrals and recommendations for businesses we don't know, have never spoken to and have never met.  This "fake" referral practice has been going on for ages. Customer Service is nil when a customer cannot call and speak with a person, and when all emails land up in the "unattended mailbox".

Review.Titre: Credit cards charged for a FREE account and refund refused!
Review.Contenu: I talked to someone in tech support to ask them why they had charged me a monthly fee every month in 2020 on TWO SEPARATE credit cards while I was taking care of a relative in another state even though I was told that, according to their records, my listing was a FREE listing. I then asked them to refund the incorrect charges and their response was "Sorry, we aren't going to refund the money we charged in error but we will stop charging you as of this month." It was unfair, uncouth and added insult to my injury! So I need to call Alignable out as a disreputable SCAM.  Way to add to the misery of everything else that happened in 2020!!!

Review.Titre: Fillmore Eye Clinic; Las Cruces
Review.Contenu: The customer service/patient care is at the bottom of the pole.  After 4 appts over past year, I arrived at 8 am for an 8:15 am appt.  After 1 hr and 20 min and being insulted by the front desk (taller lady) I walked out -- never to return again.  Believe Dr. Fillmore would be better served to teach his people to respect other people and their time and that there is no room for being told lies or talked to unrespectful, unappreciate and their darn don't give a d---- about you as a patient came through loud a clear -- again after 1 hr. 20 and still have not seen a doctor.  Don't waste your time here.  Lots of others in LC

Review.Titre: Worst company ever stay away I hope…
Review.Contenu: Worst company ever stay away I hope everyone leaves them a 1 star rating. I canceled their services because they do not work. And they keep changing my charge card . I disputed charge they lie to the charge card company to rob me ! Stay away from them! They are liars they will not cancel even when calling as I did and they still charge my card lairs !!!!!

Review.Titre: Super racist and creepy posts to talk…
Review.Contenu: Super racist and creepy posts to talk about current events from a very racist or neo-conservative framework. I know I live in Alberta, but I"m not a racist red neck. Kept meeting people who I would avoid like the plague in real life.

Review.Titre: Alignable Harassment
Review.Contenu: Alignable is without doubt the very worst of any business networking group. There is no communication nor is there even a method through which to communicate to Alignable. I was constantly being added to groups without my permission. I responded politely,  simply asking please do not add me to groups without my permission. The final straw was being added to a group called Elevator Pitches. When I asked not to be added, I then was harassed by Kevin O'Mera, an Alignable staff person. He laughed and told me to leave my pitch before I left for good. The group then continued to harass me  with notices. I reached out to Alignable customer service but they obviously  refused to  respond. I would like to give them a minus 10. I closed out my account.

Review.Titre: I wish I could give them 0 stars
Review.Contenu: I wish I could give them 0 stars.  Terrible customer support.  They won't allow me to cancel my subscription.  They won't reply to my emails.  The "Premium Coach" feature is an absolute joke.  I wouldn't normally wish this upon any business, but I truly hope they close up shop.  Oh and when I was using it, it was absolutely useless.  If you're about to sign up for Alignable, do yourself a favor and close  the tab.

Review.Titre: This website advertises for…
Review.Contenu: This website advertises for illegitimate and fraudulent business practices who do not have business licenses, insurance or pay taxes. In particular, one that comes to mind is King Dome Roofing in Central Saanich, located at 7427 CENTRAL SAANICH RD. Phone number  (778)679-4565. Person's name: Andrew O'Connell.

Review.Titre: Alignable is great if you are in need of friends.
Review.Contenu: Alignable is great if you are looking to make Friends who are business owners and who want Referrals. I have yet to have anyone engage me to do actual business. Just a lot of Hey let's refer business to each other. I do not see the point in paying for something that has not gotten me not one lead. Just a lot of people who want business referred to them.

Review.Titre: The WORST The Small Business Networking Experience I have ever had!
Review.Contenu: Terrible service!  If I could give "minus 100 stars", I would.  I am NOT happy that non-business contacts were imported.  This was NOT made at all clear when I was going through their business profile set up.  Literally one day after halfway setting up my businesses profile I began getting emails from several  non-business contacts who were confused as to why they were receiving emails from Alignable/me out of the blue.  We promote a "No Spam" clause on our business contact page so those unwanted emails to non-business clients were not only confusing to them but also gave my business a bad look.  Alignable does not offer an easy way to go through imported contacts after the fact to to update and remove non-business contacts which is ridiculous.  Because of all of that, and the amount of time I wasted trying to figure out how to modify contacts, I found ZERO value from Alignable and ended up deleting my account.

Review.Titre: I dislike how they do business . I hate spam
Review.Contenu: We started to receive email from someone who is a customer of ours.The email acted like we were best friends with them. I have no idea who they were.So I looked up Alignable and they are a "networking" company who charges alot for a perceived value. Mainly is get other businesses looking for customers to be your customer. The initial email pretending to have only a 24 hour time limit or offer will expire. But in reality, they will keep hounding you When people sign up for the service it will ask to get access to all your contacts so they can email all your contacts on you behalf stating how great Alignable is and that they should join Alignable within 24 hours. And since the emails would be sent out just after someone JUST signed up, how  can their emails stating how great is the service?

Review.Titre: I See Dead People.
Review.Contenu: I received a request from a dead person, several months after their death.  It is beyond disturbing and should be criminal. At the very least it is pathetic. What a crap platform.

Review.Titre: Alignable's Predatory & Abusive Internet Practices
Review.Contenu: Alignable634 N. Falmouth Hwy, Suite 1666North Falmouth, MA  If I could give negative zero stars to this malevolent, pond-scum of an organization, I would. Instead, I am filing a lawsuit after numerous, unheeded COMPLAINTS which have not been remedied, and worse, copiously repeated with defiant will. It's as if they are saying, "MAKE US DO THE RIGHT THING.”  I am among the alleged (many) who issued Alignable very specific demands to delete the fraudulent use of my personal name, delete the fraudulent use of my business name, and, not least, delete from Google an entirely FALSE CLAIM THAT SUGGESTS I AM MANAGING OR ORGANIZING A NETWORKING NEWSLETTER FOR THEM! They are the LAST COMPANY on earth I would associate myself with. After Google has TWICE REMOVED this negative, false association from their search engine, (twice within two weeks), Alignable has brazenly re-posted it on their URL it within 24 hours. This behavior is not only predatory, they are using unsuspecting people's bright reputations to try and boost their own deplorable internet profile. STEER FAR AWAY unless, of course, you like this kind of abuse.

Review.Titre: This is totally worthless
Review.Contenu: This is totally worthless It will help you zero If you enjoy expressing yourself this is a platform If you want to make money , this is not the platform Please remove me froYour participants I find it annoying and have requested to not renew I give this platform a minus 100 .. worthless

Review.Titre: Alignable is hard to use and really not…
Review.Contenu: Alignable is hard to use and really not worth the effort. I tried it and joined several groups. Most have a no self promotion clause in their rules. If this is to promote your business, you have to self promote. But that is not allowed by every group I joined. There are restrictions on introducing yourself and your business. All of this is really strange for a site that is there to promote a business. I made one post on a women's business site. It was taken down as self promotion even though I saw other posts up for several weeks exactly like it. Maybe it is who you are? If you get an invite. PASS. It is not worth the time.Update: I got a reply from Alignable wanting to talk to me about my experience. I found that reply catering to my experience with their website by saying they are examining their no self-promotion policy What is the use of having a site to promote your business if you are unable to promote your business.

Review.Titre: I never signed up for Alignable that I…
Review.Contenu: I never signed up for Alignable that I know of but I keep getting email invites from people in my area but don't know. I never write bad reviews. This is actually my first, but wanted people to know.  I called one of the email invites to see if he actually sent me an invite to connect or if it was a bot.  He had no idea what I was talking about and yelled "I do not know you.. and hung up". Obviously, he did not send the invite to connect. Hah.  This is a scam/bot illegally getting your contacts and others and sending fake invites to people and businesses in the area.

Review.Titre: Absolutely the worst social media…
Review.Contenu: Absolutely the worst social media platform to say the least. I stopped using Alignable 5 months ago. All of a sudden late January of this year, i get charges of $420. I emailed several times about the charges and to credit my account back the charges. Guess what....no communication. My last email to them this month was letting them know how unprofessional they were by not responding. Instead of returning my funds that I did not authorize, they choose not to respond. Now, I am putting the claim in with my bank and providing my bank with the emails. I will be filing a complaint with BBB as well. You would think instead of making it right...this hideous social media platform chooses to keep a past customers funds and go through all the negativity of bad reviews etc. Oh by the way, before these charges from them, I received an email out the blue from support. My response was to please advise. Well darn without no response....me asking to please advise was not a greenlight to bill my account for services I had not used in 5 months. It amazes me that they were so quick to take funds, yet they lack miserably at customer service and communication.

Review.Titre: I will update this if your services…
Review.Contenu: I will update this if your services actually get our business results.  I received this review link 5 m8ns after send a post. 1 star doesn't mean it won't be a 5 I just need time. Thank you.

Review.Titre: It provides absolutely no benefit to…
Review.Contenu: It provides absolutely no benefit to business outreach and development. After testing it out for a few months, I was able to generate exactly zero leads but did manage to generate the need for new SPAM filter rules on our company e-mails server!

Review.Titre: This company somehow stole my wife's…
Review.Contenu: This company somehow stole my wife's data and created a profile without her knowledge. It then spammed her contacts about joining it.  This company should be shut down or sued!

Review.Titre: Alignable is marketed as a new social…
Review.Contenu: Alignable is marketed as a new social network site for local businesses. I was invited by an employee of a local business to the platform. They had my email in their database from 4 years ago when we reserved something in their store. I don't believe this individual intentionally invited me. I believe while registering they chose the option to allow Alignable access to their email contacts. Alignable's bot found our business url in their database. The Alignable bot is certainly an ingenious bit of spoofing. It drills into your contacts and emails other business owners with the identity of the individual who registered. That person never even knows the emails were sent out in their name. When I registered directly through the site versus the email invite from this individual, I could see how I got the initial email "invite".  Once you sign up, it unleashes relentless invites to make you engage with it. I'm seeing invites in our spam folder by businesses unrelated to our market, including out of state businesses.Do not, by any means sign up or allow anyone you know to register with Alignable. Alignable is taking in new unsuspecting victims daily. I highly suggest using the more trusted LinkedIn platform instead, until somebody else offers a safer alternative to Alignable for local businesses.

Review.Titre: Can't connect with people in my neighbourhood
Review.Contenu: Recently I can't connect people who Alignable used to send them over to my email. I used to connect to all, but now it doesn't send my request to the people which Alignable send emails to connect with them. This is so weird. And the worse is that customer service doesn't reply my messages. I reported this issue or bug  to couple of people but nobody's there to reply. I'm a bit pissed off with this system.

Review.Titre: Use at Your Own Risk
Review.Contenu: Today, my company encountered a serious issue with Alignable that I believe warrants immediate attention. Without our approval, numerous invitations were sent from our domain to group email addresses, posing as official communications from a user in our company. This not only jeopardizes our reputation but also raises severe concerns about the platform's security and integrity.We reached out to Alignable's executive team as soon as we became aware of this situation, hoping for a swift and adequate response. Regrettably, we received no communication in return, further eroding our trust in their service.At this point, we can't be sure whether Alignable's system was compromised or if this is an inherent issue with their service. Regardless, the potential damage to our reputation and the clear lack of customer support make it impossible for us to recommend Alignable to others.Our Advice: If you're considering using Alignable, proceed with caution. We strongly advise against connecting your company's domain address to their service, as you run the risk of unauthorized and potentially harmful actions being taken on your behalf.

Review.Titre: Steer clear
Review.Contenu: Literally a bogus email from "Sara" at Alignable that bounced back as a bad email address when I replied.  These are horridly bad people.  Nothing but bogus leads and made up connections.

Review.Titre: Beware, it spams all your contacts
Review.Contenu: This site blasted invites to everyone on my sister's contact list without really asking permission

Review.Titre: This company is shady AF
Review.Contenu: This company is shady AF - they will spam your entire list. I've worked with a lot of sites and vendors and I've never seen anything like it. Please do NOT use!!!!

Review.Titre: UPDATED Beware! Alignable will spam your contacts without your permission
Review.Contenu: Beware!! Alignable will spam your contact list without your permission, despite assurances on their website that they won't. I have been getting an influx of new connection requests in the past week from my contacts (after months of nothing) and discovered just this morning that Alignable emailed 60+ of my contacts with the same generic connection request. The company clearly doesn't care, as evidenced by the ridiculous non-response from Alignable on the many similar comments about the same issue in which they only restate that they won't do what they are obviously doing.*Edit to address Alignable's 4/4/23 reply: I went through the "onboarding" process months ago and at that time I did "skip" the option to invite others. I am very aware of this option and always decline it (on this and other platforms). The incident I reported was *not* the result of user error during account setup. Again, these connection request messages were sent by Alignable without any choice or initiation on my part. Further, colleagues of mine have been reporting the same thing happening to them in the past few weeks: contact requests are being sent on their behalf with neither their knowledge nor permission. Despite making multiple attempts to raise this concern with Alignable – that there may be something wrong on their end that needs further investigation – the company keeps repeating the assertion that they will never send out connection requests without the user's permission and attempting to deflect these concerns by blaming user error. Interestingly, a search online shows that users have been complaining about this *exact* issue for more than a year, and probably far longer. The fact that the issue still persists clearly demonstrates that Alignable knows about the problem but doesn't care and has no intention of solving the issue. I will continue to warn others about the issues at Alignable and the need for users to protect do everything they can to protect themselves (ideally by avoiding Alignable entirely), since the company clearly won't.

Review.Titre: Poor and unproductive business engagement
Review.Contenu: Aside from having been useless at making business connections for me, I deactivated my account because of an unscientific public survey regarding masking and vaccinations. This "survey" could be answered multiple times and did not reflect actual local business standards. It was disproportionately flooded with misinformation and invited controversial and non-productive dialogue which had the potential to reflect negatively on business. This was extremely poor business practice and Alignable should have known better.

Review.Titre: I am a doctor who was registered with…
Review.Contenu: I am a doctor who was registered with alignable. One person wrote that he has chest pain and wanted treatment. I have no protection for this kind of situation and I may have to employ a lawyer.This is an emergency situation and he was I guess trying to trap me into litigation.If you are a professional please think twice about joining this group

Review.Titre: I think there’s too much work to reach…
Review.Contenu: I think there’s too much work to reach out and find the right partnerships for people to make relationships during Covid that cannot be face-to-face or introduces businesses that could work together. I sponsored a newsletter I never got any kind of replies I think there should be more follow through on your companies and complementing or endorsing companies that spend the money on the newsletters as well as trying to pair off. I tried to disenroll but paid for a year

Review.Titre: Spam generator
Review.Contenu: Spam generator, nothing more. I got an invite from a 10 year old personal contact after Alignable dug into email history and spammed invites to any contacts without this person's knowledgeable consent. These are data collectors and profiteers, not community builders. Do not sign up. Do not give them your email. Avoid at all costs.

Review.Titre: alignable wants a better score
Review.Contenu: Alignable has some issues where users mistakenly email their entire contact lists. I'm not sure why people enjoy this service and have never signed up. I notice a lot of the 5 star reviews they got here are all from July 15-16th, whereas prior to that time their reviews are spread out and closer to 1 star. Also my 1 star review was flagged by alignable to try and get it removed.

Review.Titre: I did not sign up for this service but…
Review.Contenu: I did not sign up for this service but my husband received an email "from me" saying that I work for a business (that I do not work for) and asking that he follow the link so I can refer customers.Since it was sent a family member they obviously knew it was not sent by me and that I am not associated with the business the email claimed I was but it was very misleading to someone who may not be a closely connected.

Review.Titre: I accepted an invitation from a colleague
Review.Contenu: I accepted an invitation from a colleague to Alignable, followed the prompts, and before I knew it every single friend I had on Facebook and on my contacts were getting invites from me. I had no choice on who I wanted to invite. This was way over the top in my estimation so I spent a lot of time apologizing to very many people for getting something from me unsolicited. I quickly de-activated my account and I want nothing further to do with this outfit.

Review.Titre: This scam is pure evil
Review.Contenu: This scam is pure evil. I did not fall for it, because I don't allow myself to get hit by such obvious scams.Apparently... Someone in an industry that has nothing to do with mine, and that I haven't spoken with in probably 5 years, suddenly emails me and wants to connect about clients? HA!A quick Google search and I can tell this is a ridiculous scam. Please don't spread it. They are like a virus.

Review.Titre: Alignable have no customer service
Review.Contenu: Alignable have no customer service. No way to contact a human being. If you go for paid membership they charge you year after year without the notice. You cannot contact them to ask for refund or complain. They didn’t help my business growth s bit. And they can get quiet expensive.  Don’t waste your time and money.

Review.Titre: I have never hated a product that I…
Review.Contenu: I have never hated a product that I have never used before. Alignable is the worst perpetrator of social media invitation spam that I have ever experienced. I have received 100s of invites to Alignable, yet still do not know what Alignable is nor why I would want to use it. In reviewing the site, oh look it's a small business referral network. Like LinkedIn? If I never get another email from Alinagble again it won't be soon enough.

Review.Titre: Don't reuse your passwords
Review.Contenu: A friend who started a new business signed up, so I made a profile to help him.  Very much regret it.  Constant emails even though I have unsubscribed.  They are using the same trick LinkenIN used years ago, having something that looks like a login page but is asking for your contacts.  So someone that thinks they are logging, but in fact are giving access to their contacts.  It's a good reason to not re-use your passwords, especially the one for your email.

Review.Titre: I joined about a week ago - BIG MISTAKE!
Review.Contenu: I joined about a week ago.  I thought this company was similar to LinkedIn.  However, this morning I received an Email from one of my customers in my Email contacts that said he has received about 50 Emails from this company since I signed up - not him.   This is very negative for my business.    DO NOT SIGN UP WITH THEM!  I NEVER AGREED TO SHARE MY EMAIL CONTACTS, BUT THEY MUST HAVE THEM ANYWAY!

Review.Titre: scam....
Review.Contenu: Scam, notice the detail in all the 1 star reviews and the generic posts of the 5 star ones..?And the equal amount of 1 and 5 reviews..?  Try deactivating your account. You're instructed to click on a link to be emailed instructions.  What...? lolIn 20 years, i'm afraid our entire world will be run like this site, entirely by algorithm's. Not a single beating heart to be found...

Review.Titre: Horrible experience
Review.Contenu: Horrible experience! I was recently invited by a vendor I have known for a while. I signed up and deleted my account very quickly. The interface is horrible. The email campaigns are spammy and there are basically no free features, Plus, with LinkedIn, Google and all the other networks out there, this is a massive waste of time.

Review.Titre: No way to opt out
Review.Contenu: A business friend of mine sent me something it had his name on it it was tied to alignable I clicked on it and I’ve never been able to get the these pathetic insects off of my phone or any of my devices there’s no way to ever opt out I have contacted attorney generals in 31 states already I’m going to make it my life goal to shut this Educate everyone I can about how pathetic this company is

Review.Titre: Did not sign up for the service
Review.Contenu: Did not sign up for the service, but I saw the exact same message delivered to two individuals in our company from the same source.This networking tool should be using a legitimate (ie intentional) method of distribution rather than misrepresenting you to your contact list. Else, it appears to simply use your contacts to spread to as many people as possible in order to get a few who might willingly sign up for their paid service.

Review.Titre: They filled out my profile with wrong…
Review.Contenu: They filled out my profile with wrong information from an old defunct business without my consent, and then sent invites to hundreds of other local businesses to check it out before I could edit or proof anything - now all these potential local connections have a wrong idea of what my business does. This service is not just useless - it's potentially detrimental to your business.

Review.Titre: They deceitfully made me think I was…
Review.Contenu: They deceitfully made me think I was 'connecting' with people I knew already on the platform, but instead they were inviting everyone in my contacts list, which included some of my customers and colleagues in my industry. Now both I, and the people I know (who received an invite from me that I never sent) are bombarded with hundreds of emails and notifications each day and week. It is a nuisance and has caused my company more harm than good

Review.Titre: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE ALIGNABLE
Review.Contenu: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE WITH ALIGNABLE. UNLESS YOU PAY $30 PER MONTH, IT'S USELESS! AND IF YOU REALLY WANT IT TO BENEFIT YOUR BIZ, THEN YOU BETTER UP THE GAME BY FORKING OVER $89 PER MONTH! I DELETED MY ACCOUNT AS SOON AS I LEARNED THAT. NOT SURE WHAT THESE PEOPLE ARE SMOKING, BUT IT LOOKS LIKE THEY SHOULD HANG IT UP AND RENAME IT RESIGNABLE.COM ONLY A MORON WOULD THROW THEIR MONEY AWAY TO THESE PEOPLE.

Review.Titre: i started the process to sign up…
Review.Contenu: i started the process to sign up because I thought it was a legit website (which maybe it is).  I decided half way through the sign up process not to proceed but had already submitted my email address. Review.Titre: For Beginners Only
Review.Contenu: I have been contacted before by someone I "know" encouraging me to sign up on Alignable. Just happened again this week, and I noticed this time a notice telling me the offer would "expire in 24 hours". Now why would that be if it was simply a referral to a cool new website? It wouldn't.Notice also that all the positive reviews on 'Trustpilot' are WAY over the top, managing to hit all the key "marketing" points without citing specific and quantifiable results for their particular business. Not saying this is a complete scam, but no real online networking site I've ever seen acts this way. Real web service companies - the legitimate and useful ones like 'Mail Monkey' who ask for your contact list etc. are open about what they do (usually email management and promo activities), and about what they charge for their service. 'Alignable' is pretending to be something it is not.IMO, if anyone really needs this "service" to meet people in their area of work, then they are beginners, and will look back one day on this experience as part of their gullible early years. Seriously.

Review.Titre: I have not received any referrals yet
Review.Contenu: I have not received any referrals yet.  It has been over a year since I joined.

Review.Titre: Clear Concept, Abysmal Execution
Review.Contenu: Alignable's concept is clearly defined: become aware of and connect with local businesses.  The execution, however, borders on a train wreck.  For example, there is no place for basic, individual profiles -- e.g. if a citizen simply wants to have a profile, and then connect to local businesses.  The assumption is that everyone is part of a local business, and so you have to list your business name in your profile.  That may seem benign on its face, but consider the ramifications if you work for Amazon, Google, et al.  You'll get spammed to death.  Sure, you can enter hyphens or underscores in your profile's business name, but that's a clunky work-around.Once in the Alignable ecosystem, it is not clear what should happen.  The algorithm driving suggested connections is in dire need of training, but there is no clear path for an individual user to help it out.  There are some preference and interest settings, but they don't seem to impact anything.  To illustrate, I am a middle-aged male who's been getting the same haircut for decades; nowhere in my profile is any interest in hair services or spa services listed; yet at least 30% of the suggestions provided to me by Alignable were for stylists, salons and the like.  Maybe I live in an area with an overabundance of hair service professionals.  Or maybe Alignable is a good idea that is not executed well, at all.

Review.Titre: The website is very difficult to…
Review.Contenu: The website is very difficult to navigate and find what I want.

Review.Titre: YOU  DO  NOT  SUPPORT   THE  SMALL …
Review.Contenu: YOU  DO  NOT  SUPPORT   THE  SMALL  COMPANIES...Dr. Sasha

Review.Titre: Limited, glitchy, time-consuming
Review.Contenu: A small-business social network focused on solving business problems and helping each other succeed? Sounds great! Too bad the execution is so poor. After half a year I realized I have spent more time helping Alignable fix its issues than building connections to potential colleagues. Alignable actually makes those connections difficult. YMMV if you are based in a densely populated metropolis, but my radius of permitted contacts is way too narrow. Even when a premium member from outside my radius contacted me, I couldn't reply through Alignable unless I paid first. That makes it pretty clear where the company's priorities are. Even premium members complain of limitations on their allowed activities. It's a self-defeating way to run a social network, because your customers will take their relationship off-network (to LinkedIn, Facebook, etc.) when you make it too difficult to work within yours. About that network interface: Alignable is poorly designed and confused about its aims, so as a new user it's hard to find your way and quickly determine what this is for. (Alignable, you haven't communicated anything about yourselves that's as clear and concise as my definition in the first sentence of this review. You should steal it. And try to live up to it.) On the technical side, there are some glitches that are frankly bizarre to see in a 21st-century website. One is the way outgoing messages used to appear (thru spring 2019) with arbitrary line breaks in the middle of words. Are you guys still using Windows 98? Because that's what your message interface reminds me of. Elsewhere you'll find the interface too busy and ambiguous. I haven't forgotten how many steps it took to customize my notifications from Alignable (and trust me, you'll get a lot of them, even when there's nothing new to report). That interface was absurdly unresponsive, forcing you to click twice to expand lists, then select checkboxes one by one. I assume that was intended to make you give up. What it almost did instead was convince me to close my account -- but I can only imagine how difficult they make that process. After half a year and several contacts with Alignable staff, I am persuaded that the company leadership sees customers not as people to be served well, but as sheep to be shorn of vendable data. I don't think the situation is likely to improve.UPDATE: In reply to Nick's comment below, I believe I did enter into the spirit of Alignable's stated mission, and I was thoughtful about which businesses I approached. I don't appreciate the implication that my business was sending out too many invitations or seeking sales opportunities. Also, I cannot buy his claim that the notifications interface was made extra time-consuming "based on feedback we've had from other members." I won't accuse Nick of being dishonest, but I do not believe that that was an honest statement.

Review.Titre: Alignable is not a social media platform. That doesn't make it useless.
Review.Contenu: To be fair to Alignable, it's important to realize that the kinds of SMB that can benefit from an online networking platform are the kinds of small businesses that can benefit from (mostly local) networking of any kind. And it's important to keep in mind the word "small."--This is not LinkedIn. Real estate agents/brokers, financial advisors, accountants, plumbers, contractors: businesses that are primarily focused on a local area can network beyond where they might otherwise be able to reach. But if networking breakfasts or your local Chamber of Commerce aren't useful to you, Alignable probably won't be, either.It is not a platform for advertising. Nor is it a social network in the mold of Facebook. It IS a platform where business owners can reach out to their local business community for advice, or help, or to share experiences.So if you go into Alignable expecting to boost your sales through social advertising, you will be disappointed. If you want to connect with your peers in an ad-free, conspiracy theory-free environment, like a non-stop online MeetUp, it will work for you.I'm not on Alignable to generate business, mostly because I don't have clients/customers in my local area (and in most cases they aren't small businesses). But I enjoy being able to help a national community in my profession that I probably wouldn't reach otherwise, and it's good to be in touch with peers outside of my normal circle.

Then you went to Pro which is a monthly charge, As a small business owner especially during this Covid crisis I have to watch my money. You are also limited in the area of your business. Not to say that there hasn't been some contact...but overall not been proven to be worth my time.

Review.Contenu: One of many referral and social medias to use these days, I have to attend to many activities in the day.  I volunteer on 5 different committees for three different organizations.  Mind you I am retired and disabled but I know that the work that I do is meaningful for those who receive them.  I do what I can with what I have when I am able.  Nothing in my hands is available but what I have in my mind and heart.  These are free for you so that you may be safe and able to hear well and go about your activities of the day as others do. Review.Titre: Alignable Review
Review.Contenu: Alignable is a good way to get a lot of networking done without attending inconvenient meetings. However, whether you use the free version, or one of the paid versions, it can be difficult to land actual clients. Like a network meeting, everyone is there to sell their own stuff. While you do get your information seen, even at the highest paid membership level, my experience has been that maybe 1% or less of all the people you contact, actually do business with you. Plus, there are technical glitches with Alignable which help render it less effective, whether you pay for the service or not.

Review.Titre: Alignable is rather strange
Review.Contenu: Alignable is rather strange. They use glowing descriptions about themselves, but when you sign up it is not clear exactly how being a member will help your company, or how you can help other companies.I was sent an invitation to a webinar apparently one day before it is to be held, with no information about exactly when it will be (or even how to sign up), so it is not likely that I can fit it into my schedule.The registration process was okay, and I was invited to share my company on a "newsletter", but when I looked at the details, I found it costs a minimum of $200. Sight unseen!Yes, it's a strange company, hard to understand.

At one point I did download dozens of my contacts, but that did not result in the ability to connect with even a single business outside my current neighborhood.   I see the potential here but too difficult to connect with my own contacts who happen to be outside my immediate location.

Some of them not even have a Website so we can get to know the business and their quality.I am now starting to do a second contact to business in my network to see if I can get to know them better and start referring them. I usually search for highly recommended business and most of them related to my own.Unfortunately most of them don't return message after we do the first contact. Eider they are not interested or their are too busy or just don't see the value to have a good solid network.A lot of business don't know how to implement Alignable into the business and maybe they need some in-depth explanation or tutorials in how to use and incorporate Alignable and how to develop a solid network of contacts and referrals.No use to have a good tool like Alignable if only a few business are returning the first contact message. I always try to make contact and get into a phone conversation so I can get a better feel of the business that I want to referrer and vise versa.Maybe Alignable should promote and emphasize first and second communications between business.I think all business should promote more communication between themselves and get to know each-other better.Thank you.

Review.Titre: I'm a huge fan of Alignable
Review.Contenu: I'm a huge fan of Alignable. This is largely because I know how to leverage the capabilities it offers for maximum benefits. An astounding 95% of the business I received in my 1st year in business came directly from Alignable. This was vital for my family's survival to navigate the pandemic. I wasn't even using the paid membership! I utilized the Alignable referral platform in the best ways I knew how as a long-term marketing person. All the functionality within the Alignable platform helped me to connect with people on a much deeper level. In a 10-month period recently, I received 17 straight 5-Star Google Reviews from my Alignable clients. It simply made sense to continue to grow my network by becoming a premium member which opened up even more functionality to me. Adding Smart Connects recently has also been extremely helpful too. My bandwidth is completely stretched and my dance card is full and I love it. Frankly, Alignable coupled with my marketing talents has made my business soar! Thank you Alignable!

I try to do something positive everyday on the platform, and I love seeing my connections and recommendations continuing to grow. I especially appreciate that they offer helpful, informative training videos to help you get the most from your Alignable membership. And a special shout out to Sue Brooke, whom I was fortunate enough to meet in person! I enjoyed the platform so much after using it consistently for a few months, I upgraded to a Premium account. Highly recommend!

I hope to learn about more services and products that I feel are valuable to send to my contacts. I already recommended multiple companies to people looking for a recommendation. I especially think Alignable will be a good tool to use for my clients that are new to the area.

Review.Titre: Many great advantages to Alignable...
Review.Contenu: I have been using Alignable here in Calgary, AB for 3+ years now & it has been a very valuable tool in connecting with local businesses. With the current "atmosphere" for SMB's here in Alberta and all over the world, it has definitely been more challenging to acquire new clientele and everyone is looking for the best "price"! When I hear companies offering "free" delivery it really gets my haunches up as so many companies have been "squeezing" the delivery & transportation industry to provide "Amazon" like rates. I think that soon there will be a monumental shift in the way business is done & Alignable is definitely a part of that shift!
